Post_Title: If Jesus was God, as is claimed by a majority of christian denominations then his sacrifice meant nothing and was more a piece of theatre than practical.
post_text:
If Jesus was God, as is claimed by a majority of christian denominations then his sacrifice meant nothing and was more a piece of theatre than practical. WHY sacrifice your son in such an horrific way? 


It has been said that God killed himself  to save us , from himself.  But I argue that is more akin to the worlds wildest episode of undercover boss.

If you are rich, but get to be poor for a month, you are still rich and have no worries at the end of your trial as a poor man. 

I argue that if Christ, being God, was aware of his divinity then he knew without a doubt that his final destination was an eternity in Heaven. Then his sacrifice, whilst painful painful the short term, wasn't that big of a price to pay as he knew the outcome would be positive for himself in the long term whereas we still have a chance of damnation. 

Here is my reasoning. When you know such a place is where you are going , rather than just hope that what you have believed is true, you are immune to the fear that accompanies the act of dying in non divine beings. 

No offence meant, just trying to spark up a debate as to why I am wrong. Thanks to all who contribute.
